Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: iirc, that json param is for you sending out, not for recognition

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just need to launch the daemon to accept zerofee tx, you dont want to be sending out zero fee

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 i think you posted the required command line arg?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`-minrelaytxfee=0.00012 -blockminsize=950000 -blockmaxsize=1000000`
Is what my pool node was using

Author: 0x03#8822
Content: thus `-minrelaytxfee=0`?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes i think so

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that should be all that is needed

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
```ComputerGenie 😠Today at 9:07 AM
you don't want it 0
basically, you want a full block and in this order
paying over min
paying min
paying some
paying none```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, so forcing a minsize forces it to fill it with zero fee tx?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what if there are not enough tx?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
min isn't `never build a block smaller than this`
it's more like
`if there are a shit tone of "good" txes, then this is the least size to put those that pay us`

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so if only 10kb of tx, it will still make a block. i guess some overloaded syntax
